treatment.reference: Isolation and Characterization of New Strains of Methanogens from Cold Terrestrial Habitats Syst Appl Microbiol 26:312-318
treatment.description: Isolated from Tundra wetland soil. Had a characteristic sarcina-like cell arrangement and morphology. The cells of all these strains formed aggregates of varying size. The cell aggregates were large, reaching up to 1 mm in diameter. Metabolized a wide variety of substrates including H2/CO2, methanol, monomethylamine, dimethylamine, trimethylamine, and acetate. Did not metabolize formate, 2-propanol/CO2, 2-butanol/CO2, methanethiol, or dimethyl sulfide. Non-motile. Temperature range 5-40˚C, with temperature optimum of 35˚C.
